result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
4:17 PM Defendant Angela R Sanderson in court.  Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg in court for Angela R Sanderson.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty recites agreement into the court record.  State will amend to Posession of amphetamine, DE will enter into a DAGP for a one year period.  Court has colloquy with DE on the right to personal appearance, DE will waive this right.  

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court  will acknowledge the plea of NC, hold in abeyance for a one year period.  Agreement accepted by the court. Adj 4:21

Waive formal reading of the CC. DE/Atty will waive TL for PH.  State requests a $500.00 sign bond, absolute sobriety.
